meanings.definition: To apply ink to (a printing plate) again.
meanings.sent1: The printer reinked the plate for another round of printing.
meanings.sent2: She reinked the plate to make more copies of the document.
meanings.sent3: After a mistake, the printer reinked the plate, hoping for a better result.
meanings.sent4: The artist reinked the plate, breathing new life into the design.
meanings.sent5: With a steady hand, she reinked the plate, creating a perfect print.

meanings.definition: To apply fresh ink to (a stamp).
meanings.sent1: He carefully reinked the stamp before mailing the letter.
meanings.sent2: The collector reinked the stamp to enhance its appearance.
meanings.sent3: In a rush, she reinked the stamp, causing a smudged mess.
meanings.sent4: The teacher reinked the stamp, marking the paper with a bright red star.
meanings.sent5: With a quick motion, he reinked the stamp, ready to send off the package.

meanings.definition: To apply ink again to (a pen).
meanings.sent1: She reinked her favorite pen to continue writing her story.
meanings.sent2: He reinked the pen to ensure smooth writing.
meanings.sent3: During the exam, she quickly reinked the pen to avoid running out of ink.
meanings.sent4: The writer reinked the pen, ready to jot down new ideas.
meanings.sent5: With a twist, he reinked the pen, preparing to sign the document.
